intro: Psychotria villosa, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Psychotria villosa is also known for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain species of butterflies.
